page.title: 02FARMING IN PENDLESIDE
page.content: Farming in Pendle is mixed:beef, dairy and sheep. Many small farms have been joined together to make farms ofbigger acreage and the house and buildings sold to people who wish to live in the country. Some farmers make hay in the summer for their animals' winter feed whilst others make sileage.Some fields are kept just for grazing. Most farms have approx. 50 hectares, the fields are divided by stone walls or hawthorn hedges.Milk from the farms is collect- ed by tanker each day and taken to the dairy where it is made into butter, cheese or resold as treated milk or cream. Some farmers sell their milk in bottles to people living locally.Afarm which has 35 milkers,30 young stock, 1bull,20sheep,36lambs 2 dogs & 40hens, with 3 tractors,trailers, machines for mowing, shaking & collecting silage is fairly typical.
